citations.desc: ATTENDING VETERINARIAN AND ADEQUATE VETERINARY CARE (DEALERS AND EXHIBITORS).
citations.narrative:
Written Program of Veterinary Care
The licensee has an attending veterinarian and a written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC). However, the written
PVC is incomplete and inaccurate. The PVC only mentions avian species and has no guidelines for primate
species, the Serval or the Kinkajou at the facility. Programs of Veterinary Care Plans that are inaccurate or
incomplete make it difficult to ensure that proper veterinary care is being provided. The licensee must consult with
the attending veterinarian and develop a complete and accurate written program of veterinary care that reflects the
practices at this facility as well as all covered species at the facility. The written program of veterinary care will
ensure that there is accurate communication between the licensee and the attending veterinarian, and ensure that
all routine care and preventive care measures are done with the direction and knowledge of the attending
veterinarian.
Correct by April 1, 2015
The exit interview was conducted with the undersigned facility representative.
